column2: KENTUCKY DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: KY

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
column4: apply the brake firmly and stop.
column6: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.
column8: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.

column2: 2. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 3. When you see this sign you should:
column4: watch for traffic to the right.
column6: turn right.

column2: 4. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 5. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Intersection ahead

column2: 7. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 8. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column6: green, yellow and red

column2: 9. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver on the left.

column2: 10. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column6: avoid drinking coffee.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 11. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column6: red warning lights.

column2: 12. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column6: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column6: Do not use your brakes in this area

column2: 14. You are considered to be driving under the influence when your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is ____ or more.
15. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.
column6: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
column8: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.

column2: 16. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: Watch for bicycles
column8: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 18. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 19. You are driving at night, and a vehicle comes toward you with their high beam headlights on. You should:
column6: flash your headlights once quickly.
column8: look in the direction of the vehicle.

column2: 20. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.

column2: 21. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 22. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 23. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 24. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column6: hydroplaning.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column6: All traffic must turn

column2: 26. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 27. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column6: A school crossing

column2: 28. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.

column2: 29. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column6: when a child is about to run into the street.

column2: 30. Safety belts:
column4: must be worn at all times.
column6: should not be worn when driving at slower speeds.
column8: should not be worn if your vehicle is equipped with air bags.

column2: 31. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column6: A reflective orange triangle

column2: 32. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 33. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column6: Edge line

column2: 34. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column6: School zone ahead

column2: 36. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: AFTER you move.

column2: 37. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Divided highway ends.

column2: 38. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column6: a speed limit sign.

column2: 39. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: white; black

column2: 40. This road sign tells drivers that:
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.
